Charis

Charis are an offshoot of the Charon in the Creation Marlien, serving under the ex-Charon Immortal now named Hera. Unlike the Charon, who may generally be considered True Neutral or Lawful Neutral, the Charis are generally Chaotic Good, or Neutral Good. Thought their interference in mortal affairs is infrequent, they are generally more direct, and always less secretive than the Charon.

The Charis reside in The Celestial Plane and have a strong affinity with Positive Energy.

Origin

The Charis were founded by Hera when she laid claim to the Ubrik Pearl, an artifact left behind by the Dead Gods themselves, perhaps for this precise purposed. The pearl relieves its bearer - even a Charon - of any bonds of form imposed upon themselves and their creations by the Dead Gods, and so Hera was able to easily distinguish both herself and her subordinates from their peers.

Appearance

Hera and her servants exalt an aesthetic of intricacy and extravagance in all but their names, eschewing the complex naming conventions of the Charon along with the grim appearance imposed upon them by the Dead Gods.

Heratrexisykeari and her servants are, unlike the bleak legions of the Charon, much-varied and glamorous. Their forms draw from all manner of creatures and art forms, mundane and magical, and they favour shining gold, silver, and bronze accented by bright blues, reds, greens, and yellows in intricate patterns. Where there is a large metalic surface, it tends to be curved and burnished to perfection. Where they take on animal aspects they draw from those which are similarly heavily patterned or feature bright flares of plumage or furs.

Having surpassed the limitations of form imposed upon them by the Dead Gods, the one Immortal, Heratrexisykeari, is not limited to a single form; she favours the appearance of peackocks and peahens, sometimes disguising herself as mundanely as that, other times taking the form of a humanoid woman in extravagant clothing, and even occasionally assuming the form of a Yamaraj in jest, but with the visage of a peacock rather than a crow. Her servants too were freely shaped by her desires.

Immortals

There is only one Charis Immortal, that being the founder, Hera.

Mortals

Dea

The Dea are pseudo-immortals sustained by Hera's will, serving directly beneath her, and far more active than Hera herself. Their forms and personalities are all distinct, though they all allied.

Eidolons

While distinct from the other castes of Charis, Eidolons created from the stuff of The Celestial Plane are often employed in as messengers, warriors, or war-beasts in times of need.
